sect2.title: Miscellaneous hardware and system components
sect2.para: In addition to the core component configuration, like network authentication and security, AutoYaST2 offers a wide range of hardware and system configuration which is available by default on any system installed manually and in an interactive way. For example, it is possible to configure printers, sound devices, TV cards and any other hardware components which have a module within YaST2.
Any new configuration options that will be added to &yast2; will be automatically available as auto-installation directives.

sect3.title: Printer
sect3.para: Although Printer configuration, like other configurations can be done manually, it is recommended to use the Configuration System to create such a configuration because of the complexity and the range of options offered by such modules.

Using the configuration system will guarntee that the options provided are consisten. The following is an example of a confiuration section covering CUPS which was created using the configuration system.

example.title: Printer configuration using CUPS
example.screen: <configure> .... <cups> <classes config:type="list" /> <default>lp</default> <printers config:type="list" > <printer> <Accepting config:type="boolean" >true</Accepting> <Info>Hewlett-Packard HP LaserJet 1100</Info> <Location>Parallel printer on /dev/lp0</Location> <Name>lp</Name> <State>idle</State> <Uri>parallel:/dev/lp0</Uri> <bus>parallel</bus> <dev_name>/dev/lp0</dev_name> <device>HP LaserJet 1100</device> <ppd>/usr/share/cups/model/laserjet.ppd</ppd> <ppds/> <vendor>Hewlett-Packard</vendor> </printer> </printers> <server>10.10.1.1</server> <type config:type="integer" >0</type> </cups> .... </configure>
